Comments.Message: I get a similar problem, when I add a new news item, and I have seen this when I cut and paste some txt from a e-mail or, in the example attached, I have copied a table from my results section and pasted it in my news item.  It will destroy the formating.

What you can do is truncate the text.

Shared_Routines.truncate(Eval("Email").ToString(), 22) 

22 is the # caracters... you can customize that.

Tell me the magic # of characters and let me know... I will put it in once you figure out what # fixes your problem.

For me, it looks like 30 is max, and that leaves no space in the box.  

I would say 29 to leave a little white space.
this wont help me with my news formating issue, have a look at my "odd.doc", any ideas?
